result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephanie R. Tankersley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Defendant shall not possess any illegal substances.
Defendant shall not possess any drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961.
Defendant shall not go upon any premises where they believe such contraband as defined in Chapter 961 may be present.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by DOC.
Provide biological specimen to State Crime Lab for DNA analysis.
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.
Defendant shall possess prescription medication only by valid prescription and take in the manner and method as prescribed by physician.
Defendant shall obtain prescriptions from one pharmacy and notify Agent within 48 hours of any new or changing prescriptions.

records.addlTxt: Restriction on Firearm Possession.

D.A. John Snider appeared for the state.
Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Atty. Kavanaugh.
The pre-sentence report was reviewed by counsel, no corrections.
Victim / witness notifications were completed, per D. A.
Statements by D.A. Snider.
Statements by Atty. Kavanaugh.
Statements by defendant.
As to Count 1, the Court orders that defendant is sentenced to 5 years in the Wisconsin State Prison System.  ITOC - 2 years, period of EXS - 3 years.
This sentence is consecutive to the sentence ordered in 15 CF 305.
Conditions of extended supervision:
Pay costs and supervision fees
Submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate and abide by treatment recommendations
Shall not possess any illegal substances
Shall not possess any drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961
Shall not go upon any premises where they believe such contraband as defined in Chapter 961 may be present
Possess prescription medication only by valid prescription and take in the manner and method as prescribed by physician.
Defendant shall obtain prescriptions from one pharmacy and notify Agent within 48 hours of any new or changing prescriptions
Supply a biological specimen to State Crime Lab for DNA analysis
Defendant is eligible for both the Challenge Program and Substance Abuse Program.
Appeal rights, WEDS form, firearms and voting restrictions were provided.
